alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hardin; Perry; Wayne (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 9:17PM CST until further notice by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River At Clifton affecting Wayne, Perry, Hardin and Decatur Counties. For the Tennessee River...including Clifton...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Tennessee River At Clifton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 365.0 feet, In Decatur County, low lying areas of the Riverstone Marina become inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The river is estimated to be at 364.0 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise to 365.1 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall to 364.6 feet and begin rising again Friday evening. It will rise to 364.7 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 364.0 feet. - Flood stage is 370.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late Wednesday night at 445 AM CST.
